member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.TABLE.Functions.LkSchemas(Linkar.CredentialOptions,Linkar.Functions.LkSchemasOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the Schemas defined in Linkar Schemas, or the EntryPoint account data files, synchronously only, with TABLE output format.
member.param: Object with data necessary to access the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
This object defines the different options in base of the asked Schema Type: LKSCHEMAS, SQLMODE o DICTIONARIES.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.TABLE.Functions.LkProperties(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,Linkar.Functions.LkPropertiesOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the Schema properties list defined in Linkar Schemas or the file dictionaries, synchronously only, with TABLE output format.
member.param: Object with data necessary to access the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File name to LkProperties
This object defines the different options in base of the asked Schema Type: LKSCHEMAS, SQLMODE o DICTIONARIES.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.TABLE.Functions.GetTable(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Linkar.Functions.TableOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a query result in a table format, synchronously only.
member.param: Object with data necessary to access the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File or table name defined in Linkar Schemas. Table notation is: MainTable[.MVTable[.SVTable]]
Statement fragment specifies the selection condition. For example WITH CUSTOMER = '1'
Space-delimited list of dictionaries to read. If this list is not set, all fields are returned. For example CUSTOMER DATE ITEM
Statement fragment specifies the selection order. If there is a selection rule Linkar will execute a SSELECT, otherwise Linkar will execute a SELECT. For example BY CUSTOMER
Detailed options to be used, including: rowHeaders, rowProperties, onlyVisibe, usePropertyNames, repeatValues, applyConversion, applyFormat, calculated, pagination, regPage, numPage.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Direct.TABLE.Functions.LkSchemasAsync(Linkar.CredentialOptions,Linkar.Functions.LkSchemasOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the Schemas defined in Linkar Schemas, or the EntryPoint account data files, in a asynchronous way with TABLE output format.
member.param: Object with data necessary to access the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
This object defines the different options in base of the asked Schema Type: LKSCHEMAS, SQLMODE o DICTIONARIES.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.

member.summary: Returns the Schema properties list defined in Linkar Schemas or the file dictionaries, in a asynchronous way with TABLE output format.
member.param: Object with data necessary to access the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
File name to LkProperties
This object defines the different options in base of the asked Schema Type: LKSCHEMAS, SQLMODE o DICTIONARIES.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.

Statement fragment specifies the selection condition. For example WITH CUSTOMER = '1'
Space-delimited list of dictionaries to read. If this list is not set, all fields are returned. For example CUSTOMER DATE ITEM
Statement fragment specifies the selection order. If there is a selection rule Linkar will execute a SSELECT, otherwise Linkar will execute a SELECT. For example BY CUSTOMER
Detailed options to be used, including: rowHeaders, rowProperties, onlyVisibe, usePropertyNames, repeatValues, applyConversion, applyFormat, calculated, pagination, regPage, numPage.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.
